Get involved Become a part of MoCP’s community. Shop Visit our museum shop to purchase fine prints, publications, and […]
hours_text:
**Q: Where can I park?**

A: Pay-to-park is available on Harrison St. at the north entrance of the museum, on Wabash Ave., and surrounding streets. 

**Q: What’s the closest CTA stop?**

A: The Harrison Red Line, LaSalle Blue Line, or Harold Washington & Van Buren Brown/Green/Pink/Orange/Purple Line are all walking distance from MoCP.

**Q: Is there an admission cost?**

A: No, MoCP is free. All are welcome!

**Q: Is the museum wheelchair accessible?**

A: Yes, MoCP is located on the ground level with two street level entrances at Harrison St. and Michigan Ave. Elevators are located across from our main entrance to access the second floor of our exhibition galleries and print study room.

**Q: Are there restrooms on-site?**

A: Yes, there are restrooms available on the second floor – both are accessible by elevator and can accommodate wheelchairs.

**Q: How can I schedule a docent-led exhibition tour or permanent collection print viewing?**

A: Tours and print viewings can be requested online through our digital form. For more information about education, tours, and print viewings, please [click here](http://web.archive.org/web/20260112194550/https://www.mocp.org/collection/education-resources/).

**Q: Can I view your permanent collection online?**

A: Yes, our permanent collection is available to [view online here](http://web.archive.org/web/20260112194550/https://mocp.emuseum.com/collections/).

**Q: How can I stay up to date on upcoming exhibitions, events, and programs?**...
